column4: what happens when you kill gnome-panel? does it restart and then show the applications i currently have running, or do they disappear from the taskbar?
it restarts
and it's:         sudo killall gnome-panel
it's like restarting gnome-panel
i love nautilus...especially with sftp :P
how about dolphin? ;)
I tried dolphin when i first heard of linux...it was when I first tried "sabayon linux"...I hated that and found Ubuntu...and been here since 9.10
might've been in the early days of that particular de ;) but i love that de more than this "standard" one :)
they'll eventually all be the same with different names
so easy when sftp'ing into my iphone with nautilus
eww iphone ;)
You know what is funny...after jail breaking my iphone, it now uses "dpkg" to install .debs naturally (off subject)
well, su/sudo are nearly equally "difficult", no?
nope...  su -c "top -c"  works nicely but all ubuntu-ers are accustomed to sudo.
...for a top in super user mode
su -c "visudo"           then with vi you can change your /etc/sudoers file to allow you to use sudo...or edit yourself in the /etc/group file
yeah, but you can't say that that fedora is harder because you have to know a different standard, ubuntu is equally "hard" for a regular fedora user
good point
i've used both...I should really say it takes less time for me to setup ubuntu to where i like it.  Fedora isn't Ubuntu...
on the cli side fedora is easier, ubuntu has the different apt-* instead of basically one yum
true
enjoy
